moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 d5 3. exd5 Qxd5 4. Nc3 Qe: A speculative move, seeking to exploit superior development
moves.5... exf4+ 6. Be2 Be7 7. O-O g5: Black wants material compensation for retarded development
moves.13. c4: the start of a plan to open up the long diagonal for the dsb.
moves.13... Nc6 14. b3 h5 15. Bb2 Bf8: An attempt to spare the dsb but White eyes the long diagonal.
moves.16... Nh6: 16 ...Nh6?? is a serious tactical miscalculation. Now Black is subjected to a series of tactical blows.
moves.17. Nxf6: 17. Nxf6! Exploits the long diagonal if the Knight is captured.
moves.20. Kh1 Rg8 21. dxc6: Exploits the  virtual pin on the bishop
moves.22... Bxe1: Black takes the rook befoere it moves
moves.23. Nxg8 Nxg8 24. Qxe1: White ends up a piece up and still exploits the virtual pin.
moves.24... Kc8: Black tries to escape the pin.
moves.25. Bd4: White drives off the Queen and prepares a possible queenside attack on the king.
moves.25... Qf8 26. Nxg5 Kb7: Black's king is looking for safety, but...
moves.27. Qa5: White ties up the rook and prepares to trap the king
moves.28... Nd5: Not much better at this point, but now White starts the final attack.
moves.29. Ba6+: Sets up mate threats on the b file
moves.29... Kb8: Now only the Knight defends the king against mate, so...
moves.30. Be5: Threatens the Knight and then mate at either b7 or c7.
moves.31. Rxd5: Black resigns, once the Knight is gone, check on the b file leads to mate
